meanings.definition: Not capable of being melted or fused.
meanings.sent1: The ice cube was infusible, remaining solid even under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The metal was infusible, resisting any attempts to melt it down.
meanings.sent3: The infusible chocolate bar refused to turn into a gooey mess in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as infusible as the strongest metal, never wavering.
meanings.sent5: The infusible rock stood firm against the elements, unyielding and strong.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being infused or permeated.
meanings.sent1: The waterproof jacket was infusible, keeping the rain out completely.
meanings.sent2: The barrier was infusible, preventing any outside influences from seeping through.
meanings.sent3: The infusible bubble wrap protected the fragile items from any damage.
meanings.sent4: His mind was infusible, impervious to distractions and doubts.
meanings.sent5: The shield was infusible, creating an impenetrable defense against the enemy.
